summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from August 2021 between U.S. Department of Justice officials in London and New York, discussing a media article about Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation with the Epstein investigation causing diplomatic strain. It also includes internal discussion about a Mutual Legal Assistance (MLA) request related to a witness (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) and her status.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Subject of investigation and civil lawsuit
persons.context: The Duke of York is discussed for his refusal to cooperate with the U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's network and is facing a civil lawsuit alleging sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the central figure in the sex trafficking investigation whose network and financial affairs are being probed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as being in prison awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges, and her case is linked to the broader investigation and MLA requests.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Previously stated that U.S. authorities had received "zero cooperation" from Prince Andrew regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Quoted as accusing Prince Andrew of "stonewalling" appeals for information in the civil lawsuit filed by his client.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referred to as the plaintiff who filed a civil lawsuit alleging Prince Andrew sexually abused her. She is the 'witness' referenced in the MLA discussion.

connections.description: Prince Andrew visited Epstein's properties, and authorities are investigating the extent of his ties to Epstein.
Described as Epstein's former girlfriend and co-conspirator, facing trial for sex trafficking related to his network.
Giuffre has filed a civil lawsuit alleging Prince Andrew sexually abused her, which he denies.
Boies is the lawyer representing Giuffre in her civil case against Prince Andrew.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died in a Manhattan prison, ruled a suicide.

events.title: Prince Andrew's BBC Interview
events.description: Prince Andrew told the BBC he had not had sex with Virginia Giuffre and had no recollection of meeting her.

events.title: Berman's Statement on Lack of Cooperation
events.description: Manhattan U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman stated U.S. authorities had received "zero cooperation" from Prince Andrew.

events.title: DOJ MLA Request for Prince Andrew
events.description: The Department of Justice made an application under the US-UK mutual legal assistance treaty to seek cooperation from Prince Andrew.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed Against Prince Andrew
events.description: Virginia Giuffre filed a 15-page civil lawsuit in New York alleging Prince Andrew sexually abused her.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Pending
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is in prison awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges later in the year.

locations: 33 Nine Elms Lane, London SW11 7US (U.S. Embassy)
keyFacts: U.S. authorities expressed growing frustration over Prince Andrew's failure to cooperate with the Epstein investigation, causing diplomatic strain between the U.S. and U.K.

A Mutual Legal Assistance (MLA) request was made to the U.K. regarding a witness (context indicates Virginia Giuffre), with internal DOJ discussion about her consent and status as a witness versus a suspect.
The document references a new civil lawsuit filed by Virginia Giuffre against Prince Andrew, alleging he sexually abused her.
Authorities are investigating Epstein's financial network and how money transfers may be linked to the movement of young women and girls, seen as part of ongoing organized criminal operations.
Prince Andrew's visits to Epstein's properties, including Little St James island, Florida, and New York, are of particular interest to investigators.
